q: Mike Pence decision "major coup" for RGA- David Catanese: Mike Pence decision "major coup" for RGA Indiana Rep. Mike Pence isn't running for president, which means a gubernatorial run is almost inevitable. Mike Pence won't formally announce his gubernatorial campaign on Thursday-a state law prohibits announced candidates from raising money during the state legislative session, scheduled to end April-but he fully intends to run for governor, a source with knowledge of his thinking told POLITICO. Mike Pence was Perry's first recruitment call after he became chairman, a source with knowledge of the call told POLITICO, and Mike Pence met in Washington on Wednesday with Virginia Gov. veteran who had served as CEO of Novell and chief technology officer of Sun Microsystems, Eric Schmidt was brought in to provide some "adult supervision." On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. "I believe Larry is ready" to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. "It's time for him to have a shot at running this."

up tents in the city's central Martyrs Square similar to Tahrir. In Cairo, hundreds of state electricity workers stood in front of the South Cairo Electricity company, demanding the ouster of its director. Why are you staying here, you've ruined our lives, they chanted. Also, dozens of state museum workers demanding higher wages staged a protest in front of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, crowding around antiquities chief Zahi Hawass when he came to talk to them.
